page.title: 09RESOURCES RECOVERY BOARD
page.content: {The Sewage Plant}was built in 1959. Today it treats on average 5 million gallons of sewage per day. It employs 10 people- 2 managers and 8 manual workers. The sewage is passed through a series of 3 open and 4 closed tanks then the clean water is returned to the sea. The solid waste is used as fertiliser and the gases produce electricity. The smell is a problem in the new housing estate next door. 12 tankers are used to empty the septic tanks of houses not on the mains drains network.{The Incinerator was completed in 1979 to burn the island's solid rubbish. There is not enough space in the island to bury it. It burns a 1000 tonnes a week and employs 15 shift workers and two managers. The chimney is 100 metres high. The site also includes workshops, labs and offices.
